title: Deal or no deal? Why time is running out in a crunch week for Brexit
text:
The EU and the UK do not agree on much when it comes to Brexit, but both sides do acknowledge that time is now fast running out for a deal before next week’s quarterly EU leaders’ summit.

As Boris Johnson’s EU negotiators return to Brussels this morning to resume talks with Michel Barnier’s "Task Force 50", we look at the key issues that divide the two sides, the likely roadblocks to an agreement and the signposts to look for along the way.

What issues separate the two sides? Are the really insurmountable?

The biggest area of disagreement is how Brexit can happen for the UK "whole and entire" without creating a new border in Ireland that risks undermining the Good Friday Agreement peace deal. ...
description: The EU and the UK do not agree on much when it comes to Brexit, but both sides do acknowledge that time is now fast running out for a deal before next week’s quarterly EU leaders’ summit.
